name: Fluoxetine (Prozac)
summary: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used for depression, anxiety disorders, and other mental health conditions.
description: Fluoxetine is an SSRI that increases serotonin levels in the brain by inhibiting its reuptake into presynaptic neurons. It is FDA-approved for major depressive disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, panic disorder, bulimia nervosa, and premenstrual dysphoric disorder. Fluoxetine is notable for its long half-life, which reduces withdrawal risk compared to other SSRIs but prolongs the time needed for washout before starting certain medications.

contraindications: Concurrent use with pimozide or thioridazine

sections.text: Selectively inhibits the serotonin transporter (SERT), increasing extracellular serotonin levels and enhancing serotonergic neurotransmission.

adult.mdd: Start 20 mg once daily; may increase gradually to 40–60 mg/day as needed
adult.ocd: Start 20 mg/day; usual 40–60 mg/day; max 80 mg/day
adult.panic_disorder: Start 10 mg/day for 1 week, then 20 mg/day; max 60 mg/day
adult.pmdd: 20 mg/day continuously or during luteal phase only

sections.geriatric: Lower initial dose may be appropriate; monitor sodium
sections.hepatic_impairment: Lower doses or less frequent dosing recommended

sections.text: Onset within 1–2 weeks for anxiety; 2–4 weeks for depression; full effect in 6–8 weeks.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Risk of serotonin syndrome with serotonergic drugs
Long half-life—requires 5-week washout before starting an MAOI

sections.pregnancy: Use if benefits outweigh risks; may cause neonatal adaptation syndrome
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant for irritability or poor feeding
sections.pediatrics: Black box warning applies; monitor closely

sections.text: Although long half-life reduces withdrawal risk, taper over several weeks when possible.

items: May be activating—best taken in the morning
Preferred in patients with poor adherence due to withdrawal profile

seo.title: Fluoxetine (Prozac): SSRI Antidepressant Uses, Dosing, and Side Effects
seo.description: Fluoxetine (Prozac) is an SSRI used for depression, OCD, panic disorder, bulimia nervosa, and PMDD. Learn dosing, side effects, and interactions.
